Mylène Jeanne Gautier was born on the 12th September 1961, she is known professionally as Mylene Farmer and is of Canadian descent but is French born.

Mylene specializes in singing, songwriting, writing, she is also an occasional actress which shows in her sometimes very dynamic and large scaled music videos (Almost like a play turned film script). She was born in Pierrefonds, Quebec to a French family but was brought up in France (Hence her fluent french speaking attributes). Mylene has been very successful in her career and has sold more than 30 million records in France alone. She is considered one of the most successful French recording artists of all time.

I find it slightly unusual that I like Mylene Farmers music considering I don't speak or understand French very well. I just feel her melodies and her dramatic video scores are truly outstanding and really blend with her dynamic but also incredibly subtle sound. MTV endorsed Farmers music and played it occasionally in the late 80's, This was the first time I heard Mylene farmer's (Mylène Farmer - Sans logique) and had already made up my mind that I liked her music.

Mylene also holds a record for the most consistent number one hits in the French charts, not surprising really as the French adore Mylene, She has achieved 18 to date and amazingly 8 tracks were consecutive, Twelve of her albums have also reached number one in France.

A poster promoting Mylene Farmer. Her staged productions, both on clip and in concert, Mylène Farmer is accustomed to spectacular concerts with a very studied choreography.

Her father is called (Max Gutier) who is originally from Marseille, Mylene's mother was born in (Lennon) which is in Brittany called Marguerite. In the late 1950's the family decided to move away from France as her father was offered an engineering contract on a dam which was too good to turn down. When Mylene had reached the age of Eight the family moved back to France settling in the Parisan suburb of Ville-d'Avray. Mylene was interested in singing from a young age and when she first arrived in France in 1969 she took speech classes after her school declared her Québécois accent to be "improper", This explains why she now speaks with the accent of metropolitan France. As Mylene grew into her teenage adolescence she became passionate about horse riding, She qualified as a riding instructor at the equestrian centre in Saumar. At the age of 17 Mylene discovered acting and she left the stables to undertake a three year course at the Cours Florent, a drama school in Paris.

In spite of her drama courses, Farmer found it difficult to overcome shyness when facing an audience. She hesitantly agreed to tour in 1989. After test-singing in a small venue in Saint-Etienne, the singer went to Paris to perform at the Palais des Sports for a week in May. Following the positive response of the audience, she agreed to a full-scale 52-date tour throughout francophone Europe. A live album documenting the tour was released at the end of that year, titled En Concert, It featured a new song, "A quoi je sers" (What Am I Good For) in which she questioned the future of her career. The tour costumes were created by the famous French designer Thierry Mugler.It was also during this period that it was noticed that Farmer rarely gave interviews or appeared in public, though she is now even less inclined to public exposure than at the time.

At the age of 20, Thierry Mugler left his hometown of Strasbourg. His destination: Paris. There, his allure and style were on display for all to see. Mugler would often wear his own creations and a freelance career as a designer soon opened up to him. He began by working with major fashion houses, then created his first collection in 1973 called «Café de Paris». Going against folkloric, unstructured fashion, the collection had an urban, sexy, flirty vibe, confident in itself. It exuded avant-garde ultra-femininity, a dramatization of the everyday unveiling of a woman. It was the same Thierry Mugler style that debuted with the creation of his house in 1974. Four years later, he was named «Designer of the Year» by both the press and the public. His success story had begun. Throughout the 1980s, the Thierry Mugler brand shone brightly with acclaimed collections, ingenious fashion shows that he conceived and directed, painting-like photos that he created himself, short films, video clips and films.

Greta Garbo born Greta Lovisa Gustafsson on 18th September 1905 until 15th April 1990 was a Swedish film actress during the 1920's and 1930's. Garbo was nominated three times for the Academy Award for Best Actress and received an Academy Honorary Award in 1954 for her "Iluminous and unforgettable screen performances". In 1999 the American Film Institute ranked Garbo Fifth on their list of the greatest female stars of classic Hollywood cinema, after Katharine Hepburn, Bette Davis, Audrey Hepburn and Ingrid Bergman.

Garbo was born in Sodermalm, Stockholm in Sweden, She was the third and youngest child of Anna Loviska (1872-1944) a housewife who later worked at a jam factory, And Karl Alfred Gustafsson (1871-1920) who was a laborer. Garbo had an older brother, Sven Alfred (1898–1967), and an older sister, Alva Maria (1903–1926). Garbo was a shy daydreamer as a child and hated school, she much preferred to play alone. yet she was an imaginative child and a natural leader who became interested in theatre at an early age. She directed her friends in make believe games and performances and dreamed of becoming an actress. Later, she would participate in amateur theatre with her friends and frequent the Mosebacke Theatre. At the age of 13 Garbo graduated from school and typical of a Swedish working class girl at that time she did not continue her schooling at high school, She later acknowledged a resulting inferiority complex.

Karl Alfred was the second of seven children and the eldest son of Johan Agathon Gustafsson and Lovisa Andersdotter. Born Karl Alfrid Johansson on May 11, 1871, in Frinnaryd (Sweden), he later assumed his father's surname. Three younger brothers and a sister died before they turned five, two within a day of each other.

In the winter of 1919, the Spanish flu spread throughout Stockholm, and Garbo's father, to whom she was very close, became ill. He began missing work and eventually lost his job. Garbo stayed at home looking after him and taking him to the hospital for weekly treatments. He died in 1920 when she was 14 years old.

Garbo first worked as a soap-lather girl in a barber's shop but eventually, on the advice of her friends, applied for, and accepted, a position in the PUB department store, Pub was a major department store in Stockholm Sweden. She ran errands and worked in the millinery department.
